subsection.title: Evaluating Pieces of Different Functions
subsection.p: A piecewise defined function is literally a function that has been defined in pieces. Most likely you have encountered piecewise defined functions in every day life. Maybe you didn't know what they were called.

example.p: A tax proposal is being considered in order to simplify income tax filing. The tax a person will pay depends on their amount of income.

figure.caption: Graph of Income Tax function (pieceswise example)

example.p: Annual incomes of less than or equal to 60 (thousand dollars) are taxed at a flat rate of 15 \%.
Annual incomes greater than 60 (thousand dollars) are taxed at 15 \% for the first 60 then 35 \% for any amount over 60.

What piece of the graph do you use to calculate the income tax? It depends on the income. Of the two line segments, use the left one to calculate income tax for incomes up to 60. Use the right segment to calculate the income tax for over 60

subsection.p: The most difficult part of piecewise functions is the notation. In the following set of activities you will use a skill you already know, how to evaluate a function graphically, and transition slowly into how to write and understand piecewise notation.

subsection.title: One Function Pieced Together
subsection.p: In the previous exercise you identified the equations of three separate lines and you stated the intervals for which each line was to be used. In fact, you stated the domain for each equation. When two or more equations are put together to form one function it's called a piecewise defined functionpiecewise defined function.
The function has to state what all the formulas are and it also has to let the reader know when to use them. In short, the notation has to let the reader know the equations and their domains.
Next we learn how to set up the notation so that a reader can easily identify each formula and it's corresponding domain.

subsection.p: In the case where the given input belongs to none of the available domains, we say the function is undefined at that value. The word undefinedundefined means the function cannot use the given input so there is no way to return an output value.

subsection.title: Graphing a Piecewise Defined Function
subsection.p: We can now use our understanding of piecewise noation to read piecewise functions and graph them. Remember, the domain of a function is the collection of inputs for which the function exists. On a graph, a function is visible only for inputs in its domain and it is not visible for inputs outside its domain.
